description.narrative: Output 3.4 Local authorities and adolescents in selected locations have improved capacities to ensure social cohesion, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, disadvantaged children and their families utilise equitable access to justice and social services to prevent and respond to violence, discrimination and family separation

related-activity.ref: 2450/A0/06/003 OUTCOME 3. PROTECTION FROM VIOLENCE, DISCRIMINATION AND CONFLICT PREVENTION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.4 Local authorities and adolescents in selected locations have improved capacities to ensure social cohesion

description.narrative: 2,340 young people (33% male, 67% female) were reached through a social innovation tool called UPSHIFT within the Youth and Child-Friendly Local Governance (YCFLG) initiative. This initiative was extended to a total of 42 municipalities, encouraging them to prioritize youth concerns and needs. Limited education and leisure opportunities for girls, domestic violence, lack of safe spaces, environmental issues are among the most pressing issues in the country according to the youth. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of adolescents aware of advocacy and participation channels to influence public service important to them
Number of cities certified as youth and child-friendly
Number of private sectors companies/entrepreneurs are engaged to support YCFLG

target.value: 2020:Local municipalities in at least 5 urban and 5 rural settings reflect adolescents' priorities, especially disadvantaged in their planning and budgeting

actual.value: 2019:9 urban municipalities have budgeted 2020 operational plans for youth and child issues. 9 rural municipalities have multi-year Socio Economic Development Programmes 8 of them with budgeted plans with the commitments to address child and youth wellbeing issues

title.narrative: Existence of functional local level mechanisms for participation of adolescents especially the most disadvantaged

target.value: 2020:Young people councils established in 120 (certification) cities and 5 10 (pilot) municipalities

actual.value: 2019:Young people's councils exist in 33 piloit municipalities
